title: 1008-A
statement: A. Romajitime limit per test2 secondsmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstandard inputoutputstandard outputVitya has just started learning Berlanese language. It is known that Berlanese uses the Latin alphabet. Vowel letters are "a", "o", "u", "i", and "e". Other letters are consonant.In Berlanese, there has to be a vowel after every consonant, but there can be any letter after any vowel. The only exception is a consonant "n"; after this letter, there can be any letter (not only a vowel) or there can be no letter at all. For example, the words "harakiri", "yupie", "man", and "nbo" are Berlanese while the words "horse", "king", "my", and "nz" are not.Help Vitya find out if a word $$$s$$$ is Berlanese.InputThe first line of the input contains the string $$$s$$$ consisting of $$$|s|$$$ ($$$1\\leq |s|\\leq 100$$$) lowercase Latin letters.OutputPrint "YES" (without quotes) if there is a vowel after every consonant except "n", otherwise print "NO".You can print each letter in any case (upper or lower).ExamplesInputsumimasenOutputYESInputninjaOutputYESInputcodeforcesOutputNONoteIn the first and second samples, a vowel goes after each consonant except "n", so the word is Berlanese.In the third sample, the consonant "c" goes after the consonant "r", and the consonant "s" stands on the end, so the word is not Berlanese.

processed.result:
Given a string of lowercase letters, determine if it follows a specific rule:

* Every consonant must be followed by a vowel, except for the letter 'n'.
* The letter 'n' can be followed by any letter or no letter at all.

If the string follows this rule, output "YES". Otherwise, output "NO". 

The string will contain between 1 and 100 letters.
Determine if a given word follows a specific rule: every consonant must be followed by a vowel, except for the letter 'n' which can be followed by any letter or nothing.
